intro: Bombacopsis paraensis, commonly known as the Brazilian silk tree, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, cream-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release numerous seeds. The plant is valued for its ornamental beauty and has some traditional uses in local communities.
